wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Lancelot Edgar Connop Mervyn Perowne CBE (11 June 1902 – 24 March 1982) was a British Army officer who commanded 17th Gurkha Division.

response: * Perowne Barracks (Tuen Mun) – established in 1931 as the Tai Lam Camp. Named for British Army Major General Lancelot Perowne and once used by Tuen Mun Immigration Service Training School, now used by Crossroads International

response: The barracks, which were established as Tai Lam Military Camp in 1931, were subsequently renamed Perowne Barracks after Major General Lancelot Perowne, Major General of the Brigade of Gurkhas, who were based there.Half of site used by NGO Crossroads to be returned to gov’t for housing project, Hong Kong Free Press, by Kris Cheng, 14 September 2015 The barracks closed in 1994 as part of the withdrawal of British military presence prior to the handover of sovereignty in 1997. They were then used in the 1990s as living accommodation for Lingnan College, as a training school for the Immigration Department and more recently by the Crossroads Foundation, a charity.

In 1943 Brig Lancelot Perowne transferred from 69 AA Bde to take command of 37 AA Bde. He was a searchlight specialist from the Royal Engineers. In November 1943 he was sent to India to take over 23rd Infantry Brigade, which was training for Chindit operations, and commanded it in the Burma Campaign.Perowne at Generals of World War II.Thomas Joesbury, '60 and 80 Column Chindits 1944' at Burma Star Association.Capt Lancelot Edgar Conhop Mervyn Perowne, 'The training of the anti-aircraft searchlight spotter', The Royal Engineers Journal, September 1938, listed in .
